question: Can I have information about BUV bus services. Do we have to register to use the bus service?
answer: The BUV Bus Service is a student’s support service without any fee. However, at the beginning of semester, new students would be asked to register for BUV bus service so that BUV Transportation Team could understand the demand and arrange the suitable bus schedules. BUV provides bus routes from designated points in 04 districts of Hanoi direct to BUV Campus such as Hai Ba Trung, Cau Giay, Tay Ho, Ha Dong and Ecopark area.

question: How can I receive the bus schedules?
answer:
BUV bus service provides 2 bus schedules which are weekday schedule (from Monday to Friday) and weekend schedule.

If you are a BUV student who is attending this semester, the weekday bus schedules will be sent weekly to students' and staff’s email on every Friday with the updated schedule for the week after. The weekend schedule will be sent on every Tuesday of that week to relevant people to class or event during weekend only.

If you are a BUV student who is not attending this semester or parents who wish to receive weekly schedule, kindly joint our community on Zalo through the following QR codes

answer:
BUV bus service provides 2 bus schedules which are weekday schedule (from Monday to Friday) and weekend schedule.

If you are a BUV student who is not attending this semester or parents who wish to receive weekly schedule, kindly joint our community on Zalo through the following QR codes

question: Do BUV buses run on weekends?
answer: The bus service is available limited on the weekend for pre-booked classes or event only. If you wish to come to school at the weekend, kindly contact BUV Transportation Team at transportation@buv.edu.vn for further support.

question: How can I recognize BUV buses?
answer: You can recognize BUV buses from the advertising image of BUV on the body and/or a particular BUV signage on the front and side of the vehicle. The signage indicates the operating route of the bus.

question: How can I use the bus?
answer:
If you are BUV-ers, you must wear your student ID/ staff ID to help drivers easily identify.

If you are guest of BUV, please show your invitation from BUV’s department/ employee for the bus driver to recognize BUV’s passengers.

You are advised to arrive at the bus stop 5-10 minutes prior to the departure time to avoid missing the bus.

question: Where can I park at pick-up locations? Do I have to pay for the parking fee?
answer: You can find parking areas near all pick-up locations. Any associated parking costs and arrangements are your responsibility. You can contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 for further guidance.

question: How can I recognize pick-up/drop-off points?
answer: You can find the pick-up/ drop-off locations description on the bus schedules file GPS links of all pick-up and drop-off locations is included in the latest BUV SHUTTLE BUS OPERATION INSTRUCTION updated on 11/07/2024. Please read and follow them carefully.

question: Can I have the exact location of pick-up/drop-off points?
answer: You can find the pick-up/ drop-off locations description on the bus schedules file GPS links of all pick-up and drop-off locations is included in the latest BUV SHUTTLE BUS OPERATION INSTRUCTION updated on 11/07/2024. Please read and follow them carefully.

question: If I have left an item on the bus, how do I get it returned?
answer: You should contact BUV transportation team at 0704 068 386 as soon as you are aware of your belongings go missing after using BUV bus. Then, you are required to fill in a Lost & Found report. Once the lost item is found, you will be contacted to come and collect your belongings at the Lost & Found counter at the 1st floor reception if it matches your description.

question: What should I do if I do not receive the bus schedules?
answer:
Normally, bus schedules are sent to all attending students of the semester, staff and relevant people who have activities at BUV campus. If you belong to one of the mentioned groups and do not receive the bus schedules, please contact BUV Transportation Team at transportation@buv.edu.vn for appropriate action.
You are recommended to join our community on Zalo to be updated on weekday schedules and daily information of each route as well.

question: What should I do if the bus does not arrive on time?
answer: School buses might run late due to unforeseen circumstances like traffic, accidents, road closures, prior run delays, etc. Students should arrive at the bus stop 5-10 minutes prior to the departure time to avoid missing the bus. Kindly contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 for prompt support. If students are late to school due to the delay of BUV bus arrival, they are not marked tardy.

question: What should I do if the bus driver behaves unprofessionally?
answer: You should contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 immediately for support.

question: What should I do if the bus has bad odor or dirty inside the bus?
answer: You can report the bus condition to BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 or leave your feedback at transportation@buv.edu.vn for appropriate action.

question: Does BUV provide an alternative if the buses are fully booked?
answer: Normally, If the buses are full of registered users. You should contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 immediately for support. They will be able to assist you and take appropriate action. You can also leave your feedback at transportation@buv.edu.vn to report the incident and ensure that it is addressed.

question: What should I do if the bus goes in the wrong route?
answer: If the bus goes in the wrong route, you should contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 immediately for support. They will be able to assist you and take appropriate action. You can also leave your feedback at transportation@buv.edu.vn to report the incident and ensure that it is addressed.

question: What should I do if the bus is full?
answer: Since BUV buses only transport a maximum of 29 passengers including the bus driver on 29-seat vehicles, under no circumstances are more than 29 people allowed on a vehicle. You should not sit on the extra seat on the bus. You should not stand on the bus for your safety. Number of buses for every time slot is estimated and arranged based on the number of students attending classes at the nearest class time, in case there is a shortage of buses due to the inconsistent and unexpected bus usage routine of students, seats are allocated on a first come – first served basis and students will be prioritized over staff members. If the bus is full, you should contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386 immediately for us to arrange alternative transportation necessary.

question: What should I do in the event of “inclement weather”?
answer: In the event of “inclement weather,” drivers are instructed to follow certain procedures that could result in the bus being delayed. Students should arrive at the stop at least 05 minutes before the scheduled time and wait for at least 15 minutes after the scheduled time. Should you need any prompt support, please contact BUV Transportation Team at 0704 068 386.

question: BUV buses do not stop near my house and the schedule sometime does not fit my personal schedule. What should I do?
answer:
Beside BUV bus service, you can use Ecobus service of Ecopark alternatively. It’s recommended to use a combination of BUV bus and Ecobus service which provides more choice of destinations and time slot for your convenience. Ecobus pick-up and drop-off at entrance 2 of Vietcombank Training School opposite BUV. To purchase an Ecobus card, please visit EcoPM office at Tower C1, Rung Co Area.

You can check the schedule here for the most updated Ecobus routes.
https://ecopark.com.vn/bus-service.html

You can use EcoOne app on your phone to check your Ecobus card status (bus journey left, expiry date, …) or call Ecopark Hotline Customer Support at 1900 555 565.

question: Can I request a pick-up location that is not included in the bus schedules?
answer: BUV bus is a service between predetermined collection points and as such does require passengers to travel to a collection point. There is no private pick-up point applied.

question: Can Bus Service add the 2.30pm, 4.30pm time slot for students having classes end at 2pm/4pm?
answer:
Based on the timetable and the number of students ending class at 14:30 and 16:00 is not enough for us the arrange bus efficiency, we could not provide a bus service for individual schedule or small number of students but for the majority. Moreover, the buses must go round trips. Thus, with a limited number of buses, we can’t have a bus every hour because it's an hour just sufficient for the bus to make a one-way trip to Hanoi, and it takes another hour to come back to the campus. 

You can utilize our campus facilities or participate in many extra-curriculum activities around campus while waiting for the bus. 

Besides BUV bus, you may also use Ecobus which offers more time slots and destination for your convenience.

question: What are the operating hours of the BUV shuttle bus service between Hanoi and the BUV campus?
answer: BUV currently provides a transport service from Hanoi to BUV campus and vice versa which is operating from 6:45 AM to 7:30 PM.

question: What transport service does BUV currently provide?
answer: BUV currently provides a transport service from Hanoi to BUV campus and vice versa which is operating from 6:45 AM to 7:30 PM.

question: Are private pick-up points allowed for the BUV shuttle bus service?
answer: BUV bus is a service between predetermined collection points and as such does require passengers to travel to a collection point. There is no private pick-up point applied.

question: Are passengers required to travel to a collection point for the BUV bus service?
answer: Yes, BUV bus is a service between predetermined collection points and as such does require passengers to travel to a collection point.

question: Who is responsible for any parking costs and arrangements for BUV shuttle bus passengers?
answer: Any associated parking costs and arrangements are the users’ responsibility.

question: Where do BUV buses pick up and drop off passengers?
answer: BUV buses only pick up and drop off passengers at the designated points.

question: Are BUV buses allowed to pick up passengers at non-designated points?
answer: No, BUV buses only pick up and drop off passengers at the designated points.

question: What should passengers do to ensure they do not miss the bus?
answer: Passengers are highly advised to arrive 5-10 minutes before departure time.

question: Do BUV buses wait for passengers who are late?
answer: BUV buses will depart at the scheduled times and do not wait for latecomers.

question: What must BUV students and staff wear when using the bus?
answer: BUV students and staffs are required to wear BUV ID Cards when using the bus

question: What should other passengers present if they wish to use the BUV bus service?
answer: Other passengers who wish to use the bus should present an invitation email or document from BUV representatives.

question: How is the number of buses for each time slot determined?
answer: Number of buses for every time slot is estimated and arranged based on the number of students attending classes at the nearest class time.

question: In case of a bus shortage, how are seats allocated and who gets priority?
answer: In case there is a shortage of buses due to the inconsistent and unexpected bus usage routine of students, seats are allocated on a first come – first served basis and students will be prioritized over staff members.

question: When is the weekly bus schedule released?
answer: Weekly bus schedule will be released on every Friday of the previous week.

question: How are students notified of changes to the bus schedule?
answer: Students should keep an eye on their mailbox to get the most updated bus schedules. Should there be any changes, notice will be announced at least 1 day in advance.

question: What is the maximum number of passengers allowed on a BUV bus?
answer: BUV bus operates with 29-seater coaches, each of which should only transport a maximum of 29 passengers including the bus driver.

question: Are more than 29 passengers ever allowed on a BUV bus?
answer: Under no circumstances are more than 29 people allowed on a vehicle.

question: What right does BUV reserve regarding bus routes or slots with low usage?
answer: BUV reserves the right to cancel any bus route or bus slot if the number of users is constantly recorded as too low.

question: Under what conditions can BUV cancel a bus route or slot?
answer: BUV reserves the right to cancel any bus route or bus slot if the number of users is constantly recorded as too low.

question: What items are prohibited from being carried on the BUV buses?
answer: BUV students and staffs are strictly prohibited from carrying dangerous and flammable goods into the vehicle.

question: Are dangerous and flammable goods allowed on BUV buses?
answer: BUV students and staffs are strictly prohibited from carrying dangerous and flammable goods into the vehicle.
